definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: ChiTian looking incentive eight heavy, if you really want to die, and death on the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 池田借机激励八重，如果真的想死，也要死在战场上。

sentences.english: Small peach, has the opportunity to want to look for exhibition, so design seduce brin.
sentences.chinese: 小桃，一直借机想找阿展，于是设计勾引布林。

sentences.english: You must give me the chance to return your kindness when you visit here。
sentences.chinese: 您光临我处时我定要借机答谢您的盛情。

sentences.english: Stone let Mimi to near wei Ann, to help him to finish her plan.
sentences.chinese: 石拉让咪咪借机接近伟安，帮他来完成自己的计划。

sentences.english: Japan also took the opportunity to "go south" on the implementation of China's "attack" strategy.
sentences.chinese: 而日本也借机“南进”对中国实施“夹击”策略。

sentences.english: Then, Zhao Gao took this opportunity to ask the court, "Is this a deer or a horse?""
sentences.chinese: 然后赵高借机问各位大臣，“这是鹿还是马？”

sentences.english: More and more people appear to be taking advantage of the lower price.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的人似乎都正在借机捡便宜。

sentences.english: So tweakers, this will be a fun task for you.
sentences.chinese: 因此修改者借机，这将是对你的乐趣的任务。

sentences.english: Hong Kong's booming pleasure boat sector will probably absorb many of the former fishermen.
sentences.chinese: 而香港新兴的游船业也可能借机吸纳很多前渔民就业。

sentences.english: The tabloids know this and satisfy this obsession.
sentences.chinese: 街头小报都深谙此道，借机满足了这种欲望。

sentences.english: Recently, building materials market also tornado of sweep world cup, businessmen lend machine unripe money.
sentences.chinese: 近日，建材市场也刮起世界杯旋风，商家们借机生钱。

sentences.english: Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan is keen to build on that goodwill.
sentences.chinese: 日本首相菅直人借机建立亲善关系。

sentences.english: I make a kissing noise and get a chance to slap Mr. Evil.
sentences.chinese: 我自己做出亲吻的声音，借机掴了恶先生一个耳光。

definition: to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to take the opportunity/to take a plane
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
in the dark/in secret/on the sly/surreptitiously
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
